info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 06 at 8:01PM MDT until August 06 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL BENT, SOUTHEASTERN CROWLEY AND NORTHEASTERN OTERO COUNTIES... At 801 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain have moves away from the warned area. However, Flash flooding continues across the area. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported water running over Highway 50 near Swink, with other reports of flooded underpasses in La Junta. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... La Junta, North La Junta, Rocky Ford, Las Animas, Swink and Cheraw. This includes the following streams and drainages... Anderson Arroyo, Adobe Creek, Robinson Arroyo, Alkali Arroyo, Crooked Arroyo, Horse Creek, Purgatoire River, Tarbox Arroyo, Timpas Creek, Vandiver Arroyo, East Fork King Arroyo, King Arroyo, Arkansas River and Benton Arroyo. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
